item.title: Dog fouling, 18th July
item.description:
A dog has been allowed to foul outside, and this has been ongoing for at least six months now. The owner just lets the dog out by itself and allows it to foul without cleaning up. This is happening at the back of Follingham Court.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Drysdale Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights far too bright, 18th July
item.description:
The street lights on Kelsey Park Avenue are extremely bright. I live in the top floor of Fairleas, 11 Court Downs Road. Looking south towards Kelsey Park Avenue the view is dominated by the extremely bright street lights. See attached photos. Appreciate if the brightest can be turned down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bag fly tipping, 18th July
item.description:
This is an update for case 7864072. The black bin bag, and the added cone, have not been collected. Location is south end of Oakhurst Grove next to bike shed. I first reported the issue on July 11th and received an update on July 13th to say that it had been resolved...but nothing has been removed. Can you help please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Oakhurst Grove, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of missing paving stones, 18th July
item.description:
Keeps being a trend that every time there's been works done, they throw away the paving stones after finishing. Then patch the gaps up with odd concrete, black asphalt material or just leave it blank with just sand. Would be nice if we could make it all look like it did prior to the works, as the whole walkway look like a patchwork quilt these days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deal Porters Walk, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping and build up of debris in Kyd Brook behind playground., 18th July
item.description:
There has been flytipping and also now a build up of debris in Kyd brook behind the playground in Eynesford recreation ground. The flytipping is to the right of the baby swings just before kyd brook reaches the back of the houses. The easiest way to reach it is via a wooden bridge the other side of the park then walk along the path at the edge of the brook within the little woodland there. Unfortunately the site would not allow me to upload a photo.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eynsford Close, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, London

item.description:

item.title: Plaster being dumped down the drain by workmen attending 115 Listria Park, 18th July
item.description:
Plaster being down the public highway drain by the workmen from Peabody who are working at 115 Listria Park. It is now blocked and with thunderstorms forecast, we are worried about flooding to local houses

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Listria Park, Hackney, London

item.title: Road closed - Network rail no longer aware why, 18th July
item.description:
Junction place was closed by Network rail in 2022. I have contacted them as they only had a license to close it until September 2024. It remains closed and they advised to contact you to understand who has arranged to have it closed. It does not show up us closed on mapping services so we repeatedly have ambulances and taxis trying to use the street and reversing out causing hazardous driving conditions

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Junction Place, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
